intro: Pseudopiptocarpha garcia-barrigae, commonly known as the Garcia-Barriga's pseudopiptocarpha, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps reduce water loss. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, contributing to its ecological role in supporting pollinators.
